title: Defines the liability of consumers and banks with respect to signatures of authorized representatives in consumer transactions
summary: Defines the liability of consumers and banks with respect to signatures of authorized representatives in certain consumer transactions involving commercial paper under the uniform commercial code; sets requirements for the validity of such signatures; provides an aggrieved consumer with a private right of action and awards court costs and attorneys fees.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                          983

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011

       Introduced  by M. of A. PHEFFER -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Consumer Affairs and Protection

       AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to  the  signature
         of authorized representatives on certain instruments

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The general business law is amended by adding a new article
    2  38-B to read as follows:
    3                                ARTICLE 38-B
    4                   SIGNATURE OF AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVES
    5  SECTION 825. DEFINITIONS.
    6          826. SIGNATURE BY AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE.
    7    S 825. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE:
    8    (A) "ACCOUNT" MEANS ANY ACCOUNT WITH A BANK AND INCLUDES  A  CHECKING,
    9  TIME, INTEREST, SAVINGS, OR NEGOTIABLE ORDER OF WITHDRAWAL ACCOUNT;
   10    (B)  "BANK"  MEANS  AND INCLUDES ANY ENTITY ENGAGED IN THE BUSINESS OF
   11  BANKING;
   12    (C) "CONSUMER" MEANS ANY NATURAL PERSON;
   13    (D) "CONSUMER TRANSACTION" MEANS THE  PURCHASE  OR  LEASE  OF  OR  THE
   14  ATTEMPT TO PURCHASE OR LEASE ANY GOODS OR SERVICES BY A CONSUMER, OR THE
   15  EXTENSION  OF  OR  THE  ATTEMPT  TO  EXTEND  CREDIT TO ANY CONSUMER, FOR
   16  PERSONAL, HOUSEHOLD, OR FAMILY PURPOSES;
   17    (E) "ENTITY" MEANS A NATURAL PERSON, PARTNERSHIP, CORPORATION, LIMITED
   18  LIABILITY COMPANY, ASSOCIATION, OR OTHER LEGAL ORGANIZATION;
   19    (F) "ITEM" MEANS ANY INSTRUMENT FOR THE PAYMENT  OF  MONEY,  INCLUDING
   20  BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO  A  NONNEGOTIABLE INSTRUMENT, BUT DOES NOT INCLUDE
   21  MONEY; AND
   22    (G) "NEGOTIABLE ORDER OF WITHDRAWAL ACCOUNT" MEANS AN ACCOUNT  AUTHOR-
   23  IZED  BY  SUBDIVISION  A OF SECTION EIGHTEEN HUNDRED THIRTY-TWO OF TITLE
   24  TWELVE OF THE UNITED STATES CODE.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00933-01-1

       A. 983                              2

    1    S 826. SIGNATURE BY AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE. (A) NOTWITHSTANDING THE
    2  PROVISIONS OF ANY OTHER LAW, NO ENTITY  SHALL  SEEK  TO  ACQUIRE,  SHALL
    3  ACQUIRE,  OR  SHALL  EXERCISE  THE  POWERS OR AUTHORITY OF AN AUTHORIZED
    4  REPRESENTATIVE OF A CONSUMER, AS PROVIDED IN PART FOUR OF ARTICLE  THREE
    5  OF  THE  UNIFORM  COMMERCIAL  CODE,  IN  A  CONSUMER TRANSACTION FOR THE
    6  PURPOSE OF SIGNING  ANY  ITEM,  UNLESS  SUCH  POWERS  OR  AUTHORITY  ARE
    7  CONFERRED IN A WRITING THAT IS SIGNED BY THE CONSUMER WHO IS TO BE BOUND
    8  THEREBY  AND  IN  WHICH  THE  SCOPE  OF  THE AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE'S
    9  AUTHORITY IS CLEARLY AND SPECIFICALLY DESCRIBED IN SUCH CONSUMER'S HAND-
   10  WRITING.
   11    (B) ANY ITEM SIGNED BY AN  AUTHORIZED  REPRESENTATIVE  IN  A  CONSUMER
   12  TRANSACTION IN VIOLATION OF SUBDIVISION (A) OF THIS SECTION IS NOT PROP-
   13  ERLY PAYABLE FROM THE ACCOUNT OF ANY CONSUMER AT A BANK. IF SUCH ITEM IS
   14  PAID BY A BANK IN VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION, THE CONSUMER IS ENTITLED TO
   15  A  CREDIT  FOR  THE  AMOUNT OF THE ITEM ON THE DAY FOLLOWING THE DATE ON
   16  WHICH SUCH CONSUMER DEMANDS SUCH CREDIT.
   17    (C) IN CASE OF A DISPUTE AS TO  WHETHER  OR  NOT  A  SIGNATURE  BY  AN
   18  AUTHORIZED  REPRESENTATIVE ON AN ITEM IN A CONSUMER TRANSACTION COMPLIES
   19  WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION, A BANK HAS THE BURDEN OF  PROVING
   20  COMPLIANCE  AND,  UNTIL  IT DOES SO, SHALL CREDIT THE CONSUMER'S ACCOUNT
   21  FOR THE FULL AMOUNT OF SUCH ITEM ON THE BANKING DAY FOLLOWING  THE  DATE
   22  ON  WHICH  THE CONSUMER HAS DEMANDED SUCH CREDIT AS PROVIDED IN SUBDIVI-
   23  SION (B) OF THIS SECTION.
   24    (D) ANY ENTITY THAT SIGNS AN ITEM AS AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF A
   25  CONSUMER IN A CONSUMER TRANSACTION IN VIOLATION  OF  THE  PROVISIONS  OF
   26  THIS  SECTION, AND ANY BANK THAT FAILS TO CREDIT A CONSUMER'S ACCOUNT IN
   27  ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS SPECIFIED IN THIS SECTION, IS  LIABLE  TO
   28  SUCH  CONSUMER  FOR  THREE TIMES THE AMOUNT OF SUCH ITEM OR FIVE HUNDRED
   29  DOLLARS, WHICHEVER IS GREATER, PLUS COURT COSTS  AND  REASONABLE  ATTOR-
   30  NEY'S FEES.
   31    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
